info.title: Civitai Orchestration Consumer API
info.description: The Civitai Orchestration API is a RESTful API that allows you to interact with the Civitai Orchestration system. The API is designed to be simple and easy to use, and is built on top of the OpenAPI specification.

get.summary: Get blob by ID. This will redirect to a cacheable content URL.

parameters.name: blobId
parameters.description: The blob ID to retrieve.

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: The id of the workflow to obtain

parameters.name: nsfwLevel
parameters.description: A maximum nsfw level. If this is specified and the blob does not have a NSFW level specified or the NSFW level exceeds our max then we'll return an error

head.summary: Handles HTTP HEAD requests for a specific blob, checking its existence and NSFW level.

parameters.name: blobId
parameters.description: Identifies the specific blob to check for existence and NSFW level.

get.summary:
Get a presigned URL for browser uploads.
The returned URL points to POST /v2/consumer/blobs with a signature for authentication.

post.summary:
Upload a blob directly with on-the-fly moderation.
Supports both authenticated requests (Bearer token) and presigned URLs (sig query param).

get.summary: Serves cacheable blob content using a deterministic encrypted token

parameters.name: encryptedToken
parameters.description: The encrypted token containing blob access parameters

get.summary: Serves a blocked placeholder image with the specified dimensions

parameters.name: encryptedToken
parameters.description: The encrypted token containing blocked content parameters

post.summary:
Workflow step for generating music using ACE Step 1.5.
/// Produces full songs from text descriptions and structured lyrics.

post.description: Detects minors in media content. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the content contains minors as well as details on where minors are detected.

Generate chat completions using language models with support for text and image inputs.
/// Compatible with OpenAI Chat Completions API format.
Runs a comfy workflow. Currently there are limited nodes available. Contact support for more information.

post.summary: A workflow step that converts images to different formats and applies optional transforms.

post.description:
A workflow step that takes a message string and retuns it.
/// This step is intended for testing purposes.
Generate images through text/image inputs using any of our supported engines
Uploads an image to be used in a workflow
Generates perceptual hashes for media content to enable similarity detection and duplicate identification.
Performs NSFW level detection and content safety classification on media content.
Generate images using text as input
Synthesizes speech from text, supporting both voice cloning (Base mode with reference audio) and built-in speakers (CustomVoice mode).
Performs automatic speech recognition (ASR) on audio media, returning transcribed text with optional timestamps.

Extracts unique frames from a video at a specified rate using perceptual hashing to filter out duplicate/similar frames.
/// Useful for generating video previews, storyboards, or analyzing video content.
Generate videos through text/image inputs using any of our supported engines

post.summary: Extract metadata from videos including width, height, FPS, and duration

post.description: Performs Waifu Diffusion tagging on media content to identify characteristics, objects, and themes.

parameters.name: air
parameters.description: A unique ID for the resource being requested. See https://developer.civitai.com/docs/getting-started/ai-resource-identifier for more info on AIRs.

delete.summary: Invalidates the cache of a specific resource.

parameters.name: air
parameters.description: A unique ID for the resource being requested. See https://developer.civitai.com/docs/getting-started/ai-resource-identifier for more info on AIRs.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: One or more userIds to invalidate early access for

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description:
Whether to wait for the workflow to complete before returning or to return immediately
The request may return a 202 if the clients waits for the workflow to complete and the workflow does not complete within the requested timeout. 
In which case the client should use the token to query the status of the workflow.

parameters.name: whatif
parameters.description: Whether to actually submit the workflow or return an estimate on what would happen upon submission

parameters.name: hideMatureContent
parameters.description: When set to true, any blob that has mature won't be available and won't have a URL

inputs.text: beautiful scenery nature glass bottle landscape, purple galaxy bottle
beautiful scenery nature glass bottle landscape, purple galaxy bottle
beautiful scenery nature glass bottle landscape, purple galaxy bottle

200.description: Your server implementation should return this HTTP status code if the data was received successfully

4XX.description: If your server returns an HTTP status code indicating it does not understand the format of the payload the delivery will be treated as a failure. No retries are attempted.

5XX.description: If your server returns an HTTP status code indicating a server-side error the delivery will be treated as a failure. retries are attempted.

200.description: Your server implementation should return this HTTP status code if the data was received successfully

4XX.description: If your server returns an HTTP status code indicating it does not understand the format of the payload the delivery will be treated as a failure. No retries are attempted.

5XX.description: If your server returns an HTTP status code indicating a server-side error the delivery will be treated as a failure. retries are attempted.

200.description: Your server implementation should return this HTTP status code if the data was received successfully

4XX.description: If your server returns an HTTP status code indicating it does not understand the format of the payload the delivery will be treated as a failure. No retries are attempted.

5XX.description: If your server returns an HTTP status code indicating a server-side error the delivery will be treated as a failure. retries are attempted.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: An optional cursor to continue querying workflows from a previous query.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: How many workflows to return

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: An optional list of tags to query by

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: An optional additional query that is used to match workflows through metadata

parameters.name: ascending
parameters.description: Whether to return data from oldest to newest

parameters.name: hideMatureContent
parameters.description: When set to true, any blob that has mature won't be available and won't have a URL

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: An optional start date to filter workflows created on or after this date

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: An optional end date to filter workflows created on or before this date

parameters.name: excludeFailed
parameters.description: When set to true, excludes workflows with Failed, Expired, or Canceled status

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Specify 'application/zip' to get the response as a zip file

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: The ID of the workflow to get status for

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description:
Whether to wait for the workflow to complete before returning or to return immediately
The request may return a 202 if the clients waits for the workflow to complete and the workflow does not complete within the requested timeout. 
In which case the client should use the token to query the status of the workflow.

parameters.name: hideMatureContent
parameters.description: When set to true, any blob that has mature won't be available and won't have a URL

put.description: Updates a worfklow. This can currently be used to cancel a worfklow or override metadata and/or tags

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: The ID of the worfklow to update.

requestBody.description: The details to update on the workflow.

patch.description: Patches a worfklow using JSON Patch. This can currently be used to cancel a worfklow, update metadata and add additional tags

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: The ID of the workflow to patch

delete.description: This will delete a workflow. This may trigger a refund if the work requested with this workflow has not yet started

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: The ID of the workflow to delete.

post.description: Adds a tag to a workflow

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: The ID of the worfklow to update.

requestBody.description: The the tag to add to the workflow.

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: The ID of the worfklow to update.

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: The ID of the worfklow to update.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: The the tag to remove from the workflow.

get.summary: Get the status of a workflow step

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: The id of the workflow to get status for

parameters.name: stepName
parameters.description: The name of the step within the workflow to get status for

put.summary: Updates a step within a particular workflow.

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: The id of the workflow to update.

parameters.name: stepName
parameters.description: The name of the step to update.

requestBody.description: The details to update on the workflow step.

confidence.description: Confidence score for the classification (0.0 to 1.0).

AIRecognitionResult.description: Represents AI vs real image recognition results.

epochs.description:
Number of training epochs. An epoch is one complete pass through the training dataset.
Maximum of 20 epochs can be specified.
Note: ai-toolkit uses steps internally, calculated based on epochs, image count, and internal parameters.

numberOfRepeats.description: Number of repeats per image. This is used to calculate the total number of steps for training and can affect the training time and cost.

lr.description: Sets the learning rate for the model. This is the learning rate when performing additional learning on each attention block (and other blocks depending on the setting).

textEncoderLr.description: Sets the learning rate for the text encoder. Only used when TrainTextEncoder is true. For models with multiple text encoders, this applies to all of them.

trainTextEncoder.description: Whether to train the text encoder(s) alongside the model. Enabling this can improve prompt understanding but increases training time and memory usage.

lrScheduler.description: You can change the learning rate in the middle of learning. A scheduler is a setting for how to change the learning rate.

optimizerType.description:
The optimizer determines how to update the neural net weights during training.
Various methods have been proposed for smart learning, but the most commonly used in LoRA learning is "adamw8bit".

networkDim.description: The larger the Dim setting, the more learning information can be stored, but the possibility of learning unnecessary information other than the learning target increases. A larger Dim also increases LoRA file size.

networkAlpha.description:
The smaller the Network alpha value, the larger the stored LoRA neural net weights.
For example, with an Alpha of 16 and a Dim of 32, the strength of the weight used is 16/32 = 0.5,
meaning that the learning rate is only half as powerful as the Learning Rate setting.
            
If Alpha and Dim are the same number, the strength used will be 1 and will have no effect on the learning rate.

noiseOffset.description: Adds noise to training images. 0 adds no noise at all. A value of 1 adds strong noise.

flipAugmentation.description: If this option is turned on, the image will be horizontally flipped randomly. It can learn left and right angles, which is useful when you want to learn symmetrical people and objects.

shuffleTokens.description: Randomly changes the order of your tags during training. The intent of shuffling is to improve learning. If you are using captions (sentences), this option has no meaning.

keepTokens.description:
If your training images have tags, you can randomly shuffle them.
However, if you have words that you want to keep at the beginning, you can use this option to specify "Keep the first 0 words at the beginning".
This option does nothing if the Shuffle Tokens option is off.

AIToolkitTrainingInput.description: Base input for AI Toolkit training across all ecosystems

model.description: Optional model override (uses default ACE Step 1.5 turbo if not specified)

AceStepAudioInput.description: Input parameters for ACE Step 1.5 audio generation workflow step

AceStepAudioOutput.description: Output from ACE Step 1.5 audio generation workflow step

AceStepAudioStep.description:
Workflow step for generating music using ACE Step 1.5.
Produces full songs from text descriptions and structured lyrics.

AceStepAudioStepTemplate.description:
Workflow step for generating music using ACE Step 1.5.
Produces full songs from text descriptions and structured lyrics.

model.description: An optional model to use for age classification. If not provided, the default model will determined by the worker

mediaUrl.description: The URL of the media to classify. This can either be a URL to an image or a video or a ZIP containing multiple images

hasMinor.description: Whether any minor was detected in the dataset

numPredictions.description: Total number of age predictions made

faceRecognitionFaces.description: Face recognition results per image (if available)

faceRecognitionNumFaces.description: Total number of faces detected across all images

faceRecognitionNumUniquePeople.description: Estimated number of unique people in the dataset (based on similarity clustering)

faceRecognitionAvailable.description: Whether face recognition data is available for this result

detections.description: Array of detected people with age classifications.

AgeClassificationResult.description: Represents age classification results for media content.

confidence.description: Confidence score for the age classification (0.0 to 1.0).

isMinor.description: Whether the detected person is classified as a minor.

topK.description:
Full probability distribution across all age labels.
Keys are age labels (e.g., "Child 0-12", "Adult 21-44"), values are confidence scores (0.0 to 1.0).

AgeDetection.description: Represents a single age detection in an image.

confidence.description: Confidence score for the classification (0.0 to 1.0).

AnimeRecognitionResult.description: Represents anime vs real image recognition results.

refusal.description: Optional refusal message if the model refused to respond.

AssistantMessage.description: An assistant message representing a prior response.

duration.description: Duration of the audio in seconds

id.description: Gets the id of the blob that contains this image.

available.description: Gets a value indicating whether the blob is available.

url.description: Gets a url that can be used to preview the blob.

urlExpiresAt.description: Get when the url is set to expire

jobId.description: Get the id of the job that is associated with this blob.

blockedReason.description: Get an optional reason for why the blob was blocked. This is only set if the blob was blocked.

Blob.description: Represents a blob that gets produced as part of a specific job

x1.description: Left edge X coordinate in pixels.

y1.description: Top edge Y coordinate in pixels.

x2.description: Right edge X coordinate in pixels.

y2.description: Bottom edge Y coordinate in pixels.

BlurRegion.description: A rectangular region defined by pixel coordinates.

BlurRegionMode.description: Determines how regions are applied to the blur operation.

regions.description: Rectangular regions that define the blur mask.

BlurTransform.description: Applies a Gaussian blur with optional region-based masking.

BoundingBox.description: Represents a bounding box with coordinates.

finishReason.description: The reason the model stopped generating.

ChatCompletionContentPart.description:
Base type for message content parts.
Supports both camelCase (imageUrl) and snake_case (image_url) type discriminators via ContentPartJsonConverter.

url.description:
The image source (can be a URL, base64 data URI, or raw base64).
After processing, this will contain the blob URL.

detail.description:
The detail level for processing the image.
"low", "high", or "auto" (default).

ChatCompletionImageUrl.description: Image URL details matching OpenAI API spec.

model.description:
The model to use for chat completion.
Examples: "gpt-4o", "gpt-4-turbo", "gpt-4o-mini"

messages.description: The messages to generate a completion for.

temperature.description: Temperature for sampling (0-2). Higher values make output more random.

topP.description: Nucleus sampling parameter. Consider tokens with top_p probability mass.

maxTokens.description: Maximum number of tokens to generate.

stop.description: Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating tokens.

presencePenalty.description: Presence penalty (-2.0 to 2.0). Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far.

frequencyPenalty.description: Frequency penalty (-2.0 to 2.0). Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text.

user.description: A unique identifier for the end-user.

ChatCompletionInput.description: Input for a chat completion step, compatible with OpenAI Chat Completions API.

ChatCompletionMessage.description:
Base type for chat messages, discriminated by the "role" property.
Uses ChatCompletionMessageJsonConverter to handle polymorphism and user message content flexibility.

created.description: Unix timestamp of when the completion was created.

systemFingerprint.description: System fingerprint for the model configuration.

ChatCompletionOutput.description: Output from a chat completion step.

promptTokens.description: Number of tokens in the prompt.

completionTokens.description: Number of tokens in the generated completion.

ChatCompletionUsage.description: Token usage statistics for the completion.

ChromaAIToolkitTrainingInput.description: AI Toolkit training for Chroma models

comfyWorkflow.description: Get the comfy workflow that needs to be executed

quantity.description: The number of jobs to start with this workflow.

imageMetadata.description: External metadata that will be stored with the image

useSpineComfy.description: Opt-into using the spine controller exclusively

items.description: Either A URL, A DataURL or a Base64 string

images.description: Optional source image for image-to-video generation

ComfyLtx2CreateVideoInput.description: Create video from text prompt, optionally with a source image (ComfyUI backend)

ComfyLtx2EditVideoInput.description: Edit/transform an existing video using Canny edge control (ComfyUI backend)

ComfyLtx2ExtendVideoInput.description: Extend an existing video with new content (ComfyUI backend)

ComfyLtx2VideoGenInput.description: LTX Video v2 generation via ComfyUI backend

blobs.description: Get a list of blobs that got generated by this comfy workflow step.

transforms.description:
Optional list of transforms to apply to the image before conversion.
Transforms are applied in order.

ConvertImageInput.description: Input configuration for the ConvertImage workflow step.

ConvertImageOutput.description: Output from the ConvertImage workflow step.

ConvertImageStep.description: A workflow step that converts images to different formats and applies optional transforms.

ConvertImageStepTemplate.description: A workflow step that converts images to different formats and applies optional transforms.

refAudioUrl.description:
Reference audio URL for Base voice-cloning mode.
Accepts AIR URNs (existing resources) or HTTP(S) URLs.

refText.description:
Transcript of the reference audio.
Required for Base mode unless XVectorOnlyMode is true.

xVectorOnlyMode.description: If true, uses only speaker embedding for Base mode (ref_text not required).

speaker.description: Built-in speaker name for CustomVoice mode.

instruct.description: Optional style instruction for CustomVoice mode.

maxNewTokens.description: Optional generation cap for max tokens.

message.description: The message to be returned in the output.

EchoInput.description: Represents the input information needed for the Echo workflow step.

EchoOutput.description: Represents the output information returned from the Echo workflow step.

blobName.description: Get the name of the generated epoch assets

blobSize.description: Get the total size in bytes of the asset

sampleImages.description: Get a list of the names of the blobs that represent sample images

blobUrl.description: A presigned url that points to the epoch file

landmarks.description:
Facial landmarks (e.g., eyes, nose, mouth positions).
Dictionary keys are landmark names, values are (x, y) coordinates.

embedding.description: Face embedding vector for similarity comparison.

FaceDetection.description: Represents a single face detection with embeddings and landmarks.

boundingBox.description: Bounding box coordinates [x1, y1, x2, y2]

landmarks.description: Facial landmarks (e.g., eyes, nose, mouth positions)

hasEmbedding.description: Whether this face has an embedding (for similarity comparison)

FaceDetectionInfo.description: Information about a detected face in an image

faces.description: Array of detected faces with embeddings and landmarks.

similarityMatrix.description:
Pairwise cosine similarity matrix between detected faces.
Matrix[i][j] represents similarity between face i and face j.

FaceRecognitionResult.description: Represents face recognition results for media content.

Number of reference images per training pair (1-4).
Affects cost calculation via reference multiplier.

steps.description: Number of training steps. Must be in increments of 100.

defaultCaption.description: Default caption to use if caption files are missing from training data.

Flux2DevImageResourceTrainingInput.description: Input for Flux 2 Dev text-to-image LoRA training via FAL.

items.description: Either A URL, A DataURL or a Base64 string

Flux2Klein4bAIToolkitTrainingInput.description: AI Toolkit training for Flux2 Klein 4b-base models

Flux2Klein9bAIToolkitTrainingInput.description: AI Toolkit training for Flux2 Klein 9b-base models

Flux2KleinAIToolkitTrainingInput.description: AI Toolkit training for Flux2 Klein models (image training)

items.description: Either A URL, A DataURL or a Base64 string
Either A URL, A DataURL or a Base64 string
Either A URL, A DataURL or a Base64 string
Either A URL, A DataURL or a Base64 string

maxFrames.description:
Maximum number of frames to include in the output. Set to 1 to extract only the first frame from animated images.
When null, all frames are preserved.

sourceImage.description: Either A URL, A DataURL or a Base64 string

previewUrl.description: Gets a url that can be used to preview a resized version of the image.

previewUrlExpiresAt.description: Gets when the preview url is set to expire.

errors.description: An optional list of errors related to generation failures

weight.description: A value representing the weight applied to the ControlNet.

startStep.description: A value representing the start step selected for the ControlNet.

endStep.description: A value representing the end step selected for the ControlNet.

ImageJobControlNet.description: Information for a controlnet provided for a text to image input.

strength.description: In case of Lora and LoCon, set the strength of the network

triggerWord.description: In case of a TextualInversion, set the trigger word of the network

type.description: A legacy type set by the consumer

hideMetadata.description:
When true, metadata such as EXIF data will be stripped from the output image. Defaults to false.
Note that some formats like JPEG may still include minimal metadata even when this is false, due to encoder behavior.
Setting this to true will attempt to remove all metadata, but results may vary by format and encoder implementation.

ImageOutputFormat.description: Base class for image output formats. Uses "format" as the type discriminator.

model.description: The primary model to train upon.

trainingData.description: A url referring data to use in training.

trainingDataImagesCount.description: The number of images embedded in this training data. This is used to calculate the cost of training.

negativePrompt.description: An optional negative prompt that will get applied when generating samples

ImageResourceTrainingInput.description: Input for an image resource training step.

sampleImagesPrompts.description: The selected prompts for sample images

sampleInputImages.description: The selected images for sample images

storedAsAssets.description:
Get wether the blobs are actually stored as assets
Assets are deprecated and require a different retrieval mechanism

eta.description: Get an estimate in minutes on how long the work is expected to take

ImageTransform.description: Base class for image transforms that can be applied during image conversion.

image.description: Either A URL, A DataURL or a Base64 string

model.description: The upscaler model to use (AIR URN format).

numberOfRepeats.description: Number of times to repeat the upscale operation (1-3). Each repeat doubles the resolution.

quality.description: Quality setting for JPEG compression (1-100). Higher values produce better quality but larger files.

path.description: The JSON Pointer path to the property in the target document where the operation is to be applied.

from.description: Should be a path, required when using move, copy

value.description: The value to apply for 'add', 'replace', or 'test' operations. Not required for 'remove', 'move', or 'copy'.

JsonPatchOperation.description: Describes a single operation in a JSON Patch document. Includes the operation type, the target property path, and the value to be used.

horizontal.description: Horizontal, controls the camera's movement along the horizontal axis (translation along the x-axis).

vertical.description: Vertical, controls the camera's movement along the vertical axis (translation along the y-axis).

pan.description: Pan, controls the camera's rotation in the horizontal plane (rotation around the y-axis).

tilt.description: Tilt, controls the camera's rotation in the horizontal plane (rotation around the y-axis).

roll.description: Roll, controls the camera's rolling amount (rotation around the z-axis).

zoom.description: Zoom, controls the change in the camera's focal length, affecting the proximity of the field of view.

frontalImage.description: Either A URL, A DataURL or a Base64 string

items.description: Either A URL, A DataURL or a Base64 string

sourceImage.description: Either A URL, A DataURL or a Base64 string

endImage.description: Either A URL, A DataURL or a Base64 string

items.description: Either A URL, A DataURL or a Base64 string

sourceImage.description: Either A URL, A DataURL or a Base64 string

maxTrainEpochs.description: An epoch is one set of learning. By default, we will save a maximum of 20 epochs (evenly distributed), and they are all available for download.

numRepeats.description: Num Repeats defines how many times each individual image gets put into VRAM. As opposed to batch size, which is how many images are placed into VRAM at once.

trainBatchSize.description: Batch size is the number of images that will be placed into VRAM at once. A batch size of 2 will train two images at a time, simultaneously.

resolution.description: Specify the maximum resolution of training images. If the training images exceed the resolution specified here, they will be scaled down to this resolution

enableBucket.description: Sorts images into buckets by size for the purposes of training. If your training images are all the same size, you can turn this option off, but leaving it on has no effect.

shuffleCaption.description: Randomly changes the order of your tags during training. The intent of shuffling is to improve learning. If you are using captions (sentences), this option has no meaning.

keepTokens.description:
If your training images have tags, you can randomly shuffle them.
However, if you have words that you want to keep at the beginning, you can use this option to specify "Keep the first 0 words at the beginning".
This option does nothing if the Shuffle Tags option is off.

clipSkip.description: Determines which layer's vector output will be used. There are 12 layers, and setting the skip will select "xth from the end" of the total layers. For anime, we use 2. For everything else, 1.

flipAugmentation.description: If this option is turned on, the image will be horizontally flipped randomly. It can learn left and right angles, which is useful when you want to learn symmetrical people and objects.

unetLR.description: Sets the learning rate for U-Net. This is the learning rate when performing additional learning on each attention block (and other blocks depending on the setting) in U-Net

textEncoderLR.description: Sets the learning rate for the text encoder. The effect of additional training on text encoders affects the entire U-Net.

lrScheduler.description: You can change the learning rate in the middle of learning. A scheduler is a setting for how to change the learning rate.

lrSchedulerNumCycles.description: This option specifies how many cycles the scheduler runs during training. It is only used when "cosine_with_restarts" or "polynomial" is used as the scheduler.

minSnrGamma.description:
Learning is performed by putting noise of various strengths on the training image,
but depending on the difference in strength of the noise on which it is placed, learning will be
stable by moving closer to or farther from the learning target.
            
Min SNR gamma was introduced to compensate for that. When learning images have little noise,
it may deviate greatly from the target, so try to suppress this jump.

networkDim.description: The larger the Dim setting, the more learning information can be stored, but the possibility of learning unnecessary information other than the learning target increases. A larger Dim also increases LoRA file size.

networkAlpha.description:
The smaller the Network alpha value, the larger the stored LoRA neural net weights.
For example, with an Alpha of 16 and a Dim of 32, the strength of the weight used is 16/32 = 0.5,
meaning that the learning rate is only half as powerful as the Learning Rate setting.
            
If Alpha and Dim are the same number, the strength used will be 1 and will have no effect on the learning rate.

noiseOffset.description: Adds noise to training images. 0 adds no noise at all. A value of 1 adds strong noise.

optimizerType.description:
The optimizer determines how to update the neural net weights during training.
Various methods have been proposed for smart learning, but the most commonly used in LoRA learning
is "AdamW8bit" or "Adafactor" for SDXL.

sourceImage.description: Either A URL, A DataURL or a Base64 string

Ltx2AIToolkitTrainingInput.description: AI Toolkit training for LTX2 video models

hashTypes.description: The types of hashes to generate.

MediaHashInput.description: Represents the input information needed for the MediaHash workflow step.

hashes.description: The generated hashes, keyed by hash type (e.g., "perceptual" -> "12345678").

MediaHashOutput.description: Represents the output information returned from the MediaHash workflow step.

MediaHashType.description: Represents the type of hash algorithm to use for media content.

engine.description: The engine to use for media rating. Valid values: "default" (HiveVLM) or "civitai".

includeAgeClassification.description: Include age classification analysis in the results (civitai engine only).

includeFaceRecognition.description: Include face recognition and similarity analysis in the results (civitai engine only).

includeAIRecognition.description: Include AI vs real image detection in the results (civitai engine only, GPU-only).

includeAnimeRecognition.description: Include anime vs real image detection in the results (civitai engine only, GPU-only).

MediaRatingInput.description: Represents the input information needed for the MediaRating workflow step.

blockedReason.description: The reason the content was blocked, if any.

MediaRatingOutput.description: Represents the output information returned from the MediaRating workflow step.

sourceImage.description: Either A URL, A DataURL or a Base64 string

epochs.description:
Number of training epochs. An epoch is one complete pass through the training dataset.
Maximum of 20 epochs can be specified.

resolution.description: Specify the maximum resolution of training images. If the training images exceed the resolution specified here, they will be scaled down to this resolution

enableBucket.description: Sorts images into buckets by size for the purposes of training. If your training images are all the same size, you can turn this option off, but leaving it on has no effect.

unetLR.description: Sets the learning rate for U-Net. This is the learning rate when performing additional learning on each attention block (and other blocks depending on the setting) in U-Net

lrScheduler.description: You can change the learning rate in the middle of learning. A scheduler is a setting for how to change the learning rate.

lrSchedulerNumCycles.description: This option specifies how many cycles the scheduler runs during training. It is only used when "cosine_with_restarts" or "polynomial" is used as the scheduler.

networkDim.description: The larger the Dim setting, the more learning information can be stored, but the possibility of learning unnecessary information other than the learning target increases. A larger Dim also increases LoRA file size.

networkAlpha.description:
The smaller the Network alpha value, the larger the stored LoRA neural net weights.
For example, with an Alpha of 16 and a Dim of 32, the strength of the weight used is 16/32 = 0.5,
meaning that the learning rate is only half as powerful as the Learning Rate setting.
            
If Alpha and Dim are the same number, the strength used will be 1 and will have no effect on the learning rate.

optimizerType.description:
The optimizer determines how to update the neural net weights during training.
Various methods have been proposed for smart learning, but the most commonly used in LoRA learning
is "AdamW8bit" or "Adafactor" for SDXL.

QwenAIToolkitTrainingInput.description: AI Toolkit training for Qwen Image models

$ref.description: The dynamic assignment reference to the array to iterate over (e.g., "$stepName").

path.description: The path to the array property in the referenced step's output (e.g., "output.frames").

as.description: The variable name to use when referencing the current iteration item in template steps (e.g., "frame").

RepeatForClause.description: Represents the "for" clause in a repeat step that specifies what to iterate over.

RepeatInput.description: Represents the input information needed for the Repeat workflow step.

RepeatOutput.description: Represents the output information returned from the Repeat workflow step.

targetWidth.description: Target width in pixels. Height is calculated to maintain aspect ratio.

ResizeTransform.description: Resizes an image to a target width while maintaining aspect ratio.

air.description: An AIR ID for the resource.

invalidateAt.description: The date time to invalidate at.

earlyAccessEndsAt.description: A DateTime representing when early access for the resource ends.

checkPermission.description: A bool indicating if permission is required to use this resource.

canGenerate.description: A bool indicating if generation is enabled for this resource.

freeTrialLimit.description: An optional limit on the number of uses for this resource per user that has early acccess.

hasMatureContentRestriction.description:
A boolean indicating whether this resource restricts mature content generation.
If resources with this restriction are used in generation, then generations will automatically be enforced to not generate mature content

popularityRank.description: Get a rank between 0-1 on the popularity of the resource.

isFeatured.description: Get wether this resource is featured

publishedAt.description: The date at which this model got published

hasNSFWContentRestriction.description:
A boolean indicating whether this resource restricts to SFW content generation.
NSFWContent covers X and AA whereas MatureContent includes R rated content.

minSnrGamma.description:
Learning is performed by putting noise of various strengths on the training image,
but depending on the difference in strength of the noise on which it is placed, learning will be
stable by moving closer to or farther from the learning target.
            
Min SNR gamma was introduced to compensate for that. When learning images have little noise,
it may deviate greatly from the target, so try to suppress this jump.

model.description: The primary model to train upon.

it may deviate greatly from the target, so try to suppress this jump.

Sora2ImageToVideoInput.description:
Sora 2 Image-to-Video
FAL Endpoints:
- Standard: https://fal.ai/api/openapi/queue/openapi.json?endpoint_id=fal-ai/sora-2/image-to-video
- Pro: https://fal.ai/api/openapi/queue/openapi.json?endpoint_id=fal-ai/sora-2/image-to-video/pro

Sora2TextToVideoInput.description:
Sora 2 Text-to-Video
FAL Endpoints:
- Standard: https://fal.ai/api/openapi/queue/openapi.json?endpoint_id=fal-ai/sora-2/text-to-video
- Pro: https://fal.ai/api/openapi/queue/openapi.json?endpoint_id=fal-ai/sora-2/text-to-video/pro

SoraVideoGenInput.description:
Base class for Sora 2 video generation (OpenAI's Sora-2 model via FAL)
Since FAL has a one-to-one mapping with OpenAI's Sora API, we don't need a provider layer.
Discriminator: operation (text-to-video or image-to-video)

SystemMessage.description: A system message that sets the behavior of the assistant.

quantity.description: The number of batches to run.

model.description: The AIR of the checkpoint model to use for generation.

additionalNetworks.description: Get or set a associative list of additional networks. Use the AIR of the network as the key.

controlNets.description: Get or set a associative list of ControlNets.

steps.description: The number of steps for image generation.

cfgScale.description: The CFG scale value for image generation.

width.description: The desired image width in pixels.

height.description: The desired image height in pixels.

seed.description: The seed to use in image generation. Defaults to a random value if left unpopulated.

clipSkip.description: The clip skip value for image generation.

imageMetadata.description: External metadata that will be stored with the image

engine.description: An optional engine to use for generation.

sourceImage.description: An optional source image to trigger img-to-img

sourceImageDenoiseStrenght.description: The strength/denoise factor for img2img (0.0-1.0). Lower values preserve more of the source image.

TextToImageInput.description: Input for an text to image step.

TextToImageOutput.description: Represents the output of a TextToImage workflow step.

text.description: The text to synthesize into speech.

modelType.description: Whether the TTS used "base" (voice cloning) or "custom_voice" (built-in speaker) mode.

speaker.description: The speaker name used (set for CustomVoice mode, null for Base mode).

TrainingData.description: Represents training data in various formats

prompts.description: A selection of sample prompts to generate preview outputs during training.

negativePrompt.description: An optional negative prompt that will be applied when generating samples

TrainingInputSamples.description: Sample generation configuration for training workflows

TrainingModerationStatus.description: The moderation status of the training data

epochs.description: The trained model artifacts for each epoch

samples.description: Sample outputs (images/videos/audio) generated with this epoch's model

TrainingOutputEpochResult.description: Represents the output of a single training epoch

list.description: Get a list of individual transactions.

insufficientBuzz.description: A boolean returned with whatif requests to indicate whether the user has nsufficient buzz to run a workflow.

id.description: Gets the id of the blob that contains the media.

available.description: Gets a value indicating whether the media is available.

url.description: Gets a url that can be used to preview the media.

urlExpiresAt.description: Get when the url is set to expire

jobId.description: Get the id of the job that is associated with this media.

language.description: Optional language hint (e.g., "en", "zh") to guide transcription.

context.description: Optional context prompt to improve transcription accuracy.

returnTimeStamps.description: Whether to return word-level timestamps. Defaults to true.

language.description: The detected language of the audio.

metadata.description: An optional set of new properties to set on the workflow.

tags.description: An optional set of new tags to set on the workflow.

allowMatureContent.description: Set to true to remove the mature content restriction on the workflow.

UpdateWorkflowRequest.description: An request for updating a workflow.

metadata.description: An set of new properties to set on the workflow step.

content.description:
The message content - can be a simple string or array of content parts.
When deserialized from a string, it will be converted to a single TextContentPart.

UserMessage.description: A user message that can contain text and/or images.

frames.description: A collection of extracted unique video frames as image blobs.

totalFramesExtracted.description: The total number of unique frames extracted from the video.

VideoFrameExtractionOutput.description: Represents the output from the VideoFrameExtraction workflow step.

video.description: The video file to extract metadata from.

VideoMetadataInput.description: Represents the input information needed for the VideoMetadata workflow step.

width.description: The width of the video in pixels.

height.description: The height of the video in pixels.

fps.description: The frame rate of the video in frames per second.

VideoMetadataOutput.description: Represents the output information returned from the VideoMetadata workflow step.

VideoMetadataStep.description: Extract metadata from videos including width, height, FPS, and duration

VideoMetadataStepTemplate.description: Extract metadata from videos including width, height, FPS, and duration

threshold.description: Optional threshold for tag confidence filtering. Tags below this threshold will be excluded.

prompt.description: Optional prompt to guide the tagging process.

tags.description: The detected tags with their confidence scores.

rating.description: The content rating scores (general, sensitive, questionable, explicit).

referenceVideoUrls.description:
Reference videos for subject consistency (1-3 videos with minimum 16 FPS)
Use @Video1, @Video2, @Video3 in the prompt to reference these subjects

duration.description: Duration for reference-to-video is limited to 5 or 10 seconds

audioUrl.description:
URL of audio file for background music (3-30 seconds, up to 15 MB)
Supported for text-to-video and image-to-video only

sourceImage.description: Either A URL, A DataURL or a Base64 string

quality.description: Quality setting for WebP compression (1-100). Only applies when Lossless is false.

lossless.description: When true, uses lossless compression. When false, uses lossy compression with the Quality setting.

maxFrames.description:
Maximum number of frames to include in the output. Set to 1 to extract only the first frame from animated images.
When null, all frames are preserved.

createdAt.description: The date / time the workflow was created.

metadata.description: A collection of user defined metadata for the workflow.

startedAt.description: The date / time the workflow was started. Null if not yet started.

completedAt.description: The date / time the workflow was completed. Null if not yet complete.

tags.description: An optional list of tags for the workflow.

arguments.description: Get an associated collection of arguments

callbacks.description: An array of callback details for the workflow.

experimental.description: Get or set whether this workflow is experimental

allowMatureContent.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether mature content is allowed in this workflow.

currencies.description: An optional set of currencies to use for this workflow.

type.description: An array of event types to send to the callback.

detailed.description: Whether to include detailed output (step/workflow results) in the callback payload.

WorkflowCallback.description: Details of a callback setup for a workflow.

base.description: The base cost of this request, excludsing any tips

factors.description: A breakdown of the cost factors for this request

fixed.description: A fixed set of cost additions for this request

total.description: The total cost of this request, including tips

creators.description: The buzz tipped to the Creators who's resources were used

workflowId.description: The ID that represents the corresponding workflow.

timestamp.description: A timestamp for when this event got raised

metadata.description: Custom metadata associated with the workflow

steps.description: Details about each step in the workflow

WorkflowEventDetails.description: Detailed information about a workflow included in webhook callbacks when detailed mode is enabled.

metadata.description: Custom metadata associated with the step

input.description: The input configuration for the step

output.description: The output result from the step

cost.description: The cost of executing the step

WorkflowEventStepDetails.description: Detailed information about a workflow step within a workflow event.

WorkflowStatus.description: Values available to represent workflow status.

name.description: The name of the workflow step. Used to allow steps to refer to one another.

timeout.description: The maximum time to wait for this step to complete.

retries.description: The maximum number of times this step should be retried.

jobs.description: The jobs generated by this step.

startedAt.description: The date / time the step was started. Null if not yet started.

completedAt.description: The date / time the step was completed. Null if not yet completed.

metadata.description: A collection of user defined metadata for the workflow step.

estimatedProgressRate.description: An estimation on the current progression of this step, or null if there is no estimation

WorkflowStepEvent.description: Details of a workflow step event.

estimatedProgressRate.description: Estimated progress rate of the step (0.0 to 1.0)

retries.description: Number of times the step has been retried

metadata.description: Custom metadata associated with the step

input.description: The input configuration for the step

output.description: The output result from the step

WorkflowStepEventDetails.description: Detailed information about a workflow step included in webhook callbacks when detailed mode is enabled.

startedAt.description: The date / time the job started. Null if not yet started.

completedAt.description: The date / time the job completed. Null if not yet completed.

estimatedProgressRate.description: An estimation on the current progression of this job, or null if there is no estimation

WorkflowStepJob.description: Details of a job produced by a workflow step.

WorkflowStepJobEvent.description: Details of a workflow step job event.

precedingJobs.description: The number of preceding jobs in the queue.

startAt.description: An estimated date / time for when the job will start.

completeAt.description: An estimated date / time for when the job will complete.

WorkflowStepJobQueuePosition.description: Details of the workflow step job's queue position.

name.description: The name of the workflow step. Used to allow steps to refer to one another.

timeout.description: The maximum time to wait for this step to complete.

retries.description: The maximum number of times this step should be retried.

metadata.description: A collection of user defined metadata for the workflow step.

WorkflowStepTemplate.description: Details of a workflow step template.

metadata.description: A collection of user defined metadata that can be used to store additional information about the workflow.

tags.description:
A list of tags associated with this workflow.
Tags are indexed and can be used to search for workflows.
At most 10 tags can be assigned to a workflow. Each tag can be at most 200 characters long.

steps.description: An array of steps that compose this workflow.

callbacks.description: An array of callbacks to be triggered during the lifetime of the workflow.

arguments.description: Get an associated collection of arguments

experimental.description: Get or set whether this workflow is experimental

allowMatureContent.description:
Get or set whether this workflow should allow mature content.
When set to false, the workflow will not return any content that is marked as mature.
Additional payment options are available for workflows that do not allow mature content.

currencies.description: Limit the currencies that can be used to pay for this workflow.

civitai.description: The rate of tipping that should be allocated to civitai

creators.description: The rate of tipping that should be allocated to creators involved in this workflow

WorkflowUpgradeMode.description: Specifies how a workflow should be upgraded when mature content is detected and green or blue buzz was used for payment.
